title: Can we agree dynamic queue works in a casual system?
body:
I personally don't mind DQ when I play normals, actually I prefer it because I get the roles I want to play. As for ranked I don't think the DQ system is awful (bare with me) I think the main reason it isn't good is because of the amount of people you can play with, for the most part thats the point of DQ. I just don't think Riot knew what to do with it, I personally don't play ranked that much anymore, but I don't play blind pick because I like DQ in normals.

Edit: I realized I didn't put a reason for this post, people complain about DQ as a whole But I think its only a problem in ranked I don't see it as a problem in normals

replies.body:
>I personally don't mind DQ when I play normals, actually I prefer it because I get the roles I want to play.

https://media.giphy.com/media/qeA0jZAlsCHAI/giphy.gif

The day people can distinguish between DQ and the new Champselect, we will live in a better world...

{{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}

I mean, even Riot doesn't know the difference.
Should we really blame the community, if even the effing developers don't care to know?

DQ if pretty good for me.  Its nice not having to spam chat as the match sets up for a role or just fill since my comp didnt load chat fast enough.  Yeah the odd rager gets into a game or two sometimes but I dont think Riot has any practical way to queue as douche and give the rest of the group the option to avoid them.

Also, cant seem to remember them announcing any rewards for grouping besides a boost in ip.
Picking two which roles you are going to play **IS NOT** Dynamic Queue.
Simply seperating each side of a coin doesnt make it a different coin.
Except in this case, that'd be separating two different coins glued together.
Well thats just an overall better situation.  Who wouldn't want two coins?  XP
Unless one of those coins is rusted beyond saving.
You sir know nothing of coins.  Or of having your time wasted it seems.

> [{quoted}](name=Cujix,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EIl75sM8,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-07-06T16:06:51.300+0000)
>
> I personally don&#039;t mind DQ when I play normals, actually I prefer it because I get the roles I want to play.

I also think DQ is fine for normals, but remember that what you describing in this sentence is the New Champion Select (which I love unconditionally), and NOT Dynamic Queue.

Dynamic Queue includes the champ select because it was added all together, in fact that was one of the big points for DQ. The queue wouldn't be new if you only looked at the fact that you can invite more than two people, because in normals you could already do that.

But Dynamic Queue could be removed (i.e. only allow a single player to queue up at a time) and the New Champion Select could be kept (i.e. you put in your primary and secondary positions and are grouped with other teammates based on your desired position), so, to me, they seem like separate things. I agree that most people see them as being the same thing, since they were both added at the same time.

I mean yeah you can take them apart but when riot talked about DQ they didn't separate them. As of now I see DQ and champ select being the apart of the same thing, because if you want one you get the other.
Champ select is fine too.  The Ranked mentality is much more of a problem than simply having the ability to play with an extra person or two.

yes we can.. however unranked was ALWAYS invite as many friends as u want and therefore was ALWAYS dynamic que.. and RANKED is not "casual"

so we can still all agree to get this toxic Dynamic Que shit out of ranked..

Ranked Dynamic Normals with no lock on who you can play with, Ranked Solo or Solo/Duo, Blind Pick, ARAMs, Twisted Treeline...

That's all they need to do I don't know why they won't lol

This keeps people from smurfing to play with friends cuz they can play unlocked dynamic with friends in a ranked setting, and it allows me to play alone or with a buddy in a closely matched game with less smurfs cuz why would they wanna smurf unless it's just to beat on scrubs when alone. Sure there's a group of people like that, but seems like a lot of smurfs did it more to play with friends at lower ranks than anything else.

Disagree. My games have been VERY toxic. Enemy premades are flashing taunts, emotes, and badges on dead bodies. Premades are allowed to get away with murder and not get in trouble for it. They can have their entire team report one person, usually the fill in, and that player will get in trouble.

The problem is Riot is going to segregate casual and ranked players even more if they do this. Do casual players that have no desire to play ranked, be forced to deal with the problems we have now? They will get paired with toxic premades and go against them, they will not receive the same rewards, there will still be no communication, and it just isn't fun to lose four to five games in a row because you are up against a premade of three or more.

It's not fun for casual players and it is not fun for ranked players. What makes ranked players so special that they need to have everything adjusted to them? Are you saying casual players do not matter? The system of Dynamic Que itself is poorly designed, though out, and favors too much towards group play. We all know to a certain extent League of Legends is a team centered game. Riot has to understand that there are players that prefer to play by themselves. Forcing players to fill spots of premades and go up against them, with none of the same rewards, is not going to solve the problems. Ranked and normal matches should function the same matchmaking wise . . . . and Riot shouldn't force any player to play how they want them to play.

But all the thing you've said happened prior to DQ, premades have always been a thing in normals.

Also players are less toxic in normals because there's nothing to lose, sure some people still want to win but basically there is on the line compared to ranked. I play groups of 4 in normal games and I mean personally we don't bother the other player, there's no reason too. The reason I bring this up is in normals people are there to play the game, thats all, while in ranked you're there to win and climb, people will be more volatile ranked always. As for casual players mattering more or less, riot already shows the buff and nerf characters based on competitive play so theres that.

I think the thing is that DQ has made premades more noticeable and with ranked people can climb together doesn't really show they are performing better then they once were. Where as in normals there isn't anything to climb its just people playing the game.

Again, I will say that it isn't fair to favor ranked players over casuals. Premades receive better rewards, are more toxic to other players, and players are losing 70% of their matches against premades. Dynamic Que favors premades way to much without any compensation to solo players. Casual players do matter and stop acting as if ranked players are high and mighty compared to them. You sound elitist right now.
I don't think you understand where I stand, I am one of the casual players.
